result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+)

Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with the victims, victim's residences or places of employment.  No contact with the victim's family.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.  Not to operate any motor vehicle.  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin without permission of the Court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM - case called.  Defendant John James Lahti appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail. Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared in court, specially.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smith - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard.  Statements made by victim's family.  Argument by State as to bond.  Statement by Atty Smith regarding bond.  Court sets bond.  Atty Smith waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Statement by Atty Smith regarding property bond.  Response by Atty Ellis.  Statement by the Court.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Copy of notice faxed and emailed with Bond
